name: Yarimoji
comment:
â¤ï¸ðŸ˜º Simple and light Elm package for emojis ðŸ˜ƒâ¤ï¸.

This package have functions to search from match string on input field and
translate to emoji or else use a emoji picker for your elm app,
only contains a database with a few emojis.

You can use this package for string replace of emojis and/ or
emoji picker if you want:

  - yariFindEmoji, yariMojiTranslate for (string find and replace).
  - use emoji picker like example in update function (used for emoji picker).

ðŸ˜Ž **Still free to contribute with this package. We need tests and more emojis** ðŸ˜‰

The proposal of this package is to add emojis to an web chat opensource make with
Elm and Elixir, promoted by [Yarilabs](http://www.yarilabs.com/).


# Types

@docs YmojiMsg, YmojiModel


# Functions for emoji picker

@docs update, ymojiPickup, initYmojiModel


# Other utils functions

@docs yariMojiTranslate, yariFindEmoji, yariCheckEmoji, yariReplacebyEmoji


# Emoji database

@docs emojidb

values.name: initYmojiModel
values.comment: init a model for state of menu picker

values.name: update
values.comment:
Update function for emoji picker

    import Yarimoji.Yarimoji as Ymoji

    type Msg
        = SetNewMessage String
        | YmojiMsg Ymoji.YmojiMsg
        | NoOp

    type alias Model =
        { newMessage : String
        , ymojiModel : Ymoji.YmojiModel
        }

    initModel : Model
    initModel =
        { newMessage = ""
        , ymojiModel = Ymoji.initYmojiModel
        }


    -- Update

    update : Msg -> Model -> ( Model, Cmd Msg )
    update msg model =
        case msg of
            YmojiMsg msg ->
                (!) { model | ymojiModel = (Ymoji.update msg model.ymojiModel) } []


    -- View

    view : Model -> Html Msg
    view model =
        div []
            [ (Ymoji.ymojiPickup SetNewMessage YmojiMsg model.ymojiModel)
            , input [ onInput SetNewMessage, value model.newMessage ] []
            ]

values.name: yariCheckEmoji
values.comment:
Check if exist any emoji on string

    yariCheckEmoji "some message :D "
    -- returns a bool if any key found on emojidb

values.name: yariFindEmoji
values.comment:
Find emoji on a string

    import Yarimoji as Ymoji

    ymojiFind =
        "Hello :D !"
            |> Ymoji.yariFindEmoji


    -- output [("ðŸ˜Š",":D")]

values.name: yariMojiTranslate
values.comment:
This is for translate from string to emoji fonts

      import Yarimoji as Ymoji

      ymojiTranslateMessage =
          "Hello :D !"
          |> Ymoji.yariFindEmoji
          |> Ymoji.yariMojiTranslate str

      -- output "Hello ðŸ˜Š!"

values.name: yariReplacebyEmoji
values.comment: Replaces all matched keys of emojis on a determinate string

values.name: ymojiPickup
values.comment:
A Pickup, pop's a window with all emojis on db for choose. this is a view
of this widget.
